clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects Of Remote Organ Ischemic Preconditioning On Systemic Inflammatory And Glycocalyx Integrity Parameters
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects Of Remote Organ Ischemic Preconditioning On Systemic Inflammatory And Glycocalyx Integrity Parameters In Living-Donor Liver Transplantation Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Ischemia-reperfusion (IR) injury during liver transplantation is one of the major causes of mortality and morbidity associated with transplantation. Remote organ ischemic preconditioning (RIPC) is one of the most investigated practices to reduce IR injury. In this study, for the first time in the clinic, the effect of RIPC will be evaluated via both systemic inflammation parameters and also parameters showing glycocalyx integrity, on living-donor liver recipients.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Postoperative early period (6 hours after intensive care unite admission)
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of TNF-alpha level difference between groups

primary_outcome.time_frame: Postoperative early period (6 hours after intensive care unite admission)
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of (ICAM-1) level difference between group

primary_outcome.time_frame: Postoperative early period (6 hours after intensive care unite admission)
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of HIF-1 level difference between groups

primary_outcome.time_frame: Postoperative early period (6 hours after intensive care unite admission)
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of IL-8 level difference between groups

primary_outcome.time_frame: Postoperative early period (6 hours after intensive care unite admission)
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of SDC-1 level difference between groups

primary_outcome.time_frame: Postoperative early period (6 hours after intensive care unite admission)
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of sVCAM-1 level difference between groups

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of early postoperative liver function tests; AST and ALT

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of stay in hospital and intensive care unit
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the length of stay in hospital and intensive care unit

arm_group.description: Short-term tourniquet on to the lower extremity before surgery

intervention.description: An orthopedic tourniquet was tied to the right lower extremities of the patients in RIPC arm, and tourniquet application was performed before the anhepatic phase in 3 periods of 3 minutes with an interval of 3 minutes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients followed up by Acıbadem Hospital Organ Transplantation Center
- Patients accepted to participate in the study
- Older than 18 years of age
- ASA class III
- MELD score >12
- Scheduled for elective liver transplantation surgery from a living donor
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing re-transplantation
- Under the age of 18 years
- Patients undergoing emergency surgery
- Patients with hepatorenal or hepatopulmonary syndrome
- Patients receiving mechanical ventilation support in the ICU
- Patients refusing to participate

facility.name: Acıbadem Mehmet Ali Aydinlar University Atakent Hospital
